definition: to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

sentences.english: As he looked out, a fantastic smell came to his nose.
sentences.chinese: 当他伸出头时，一股诱人的香味扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: As long as you get closer to the nose longans , a faint scent came on smelling.
sentences.chinese: 你只要把鼻子凑近桂圆，一种淡淡的清香就扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: The food with a sharp aroma increases people's appetite consideraBly.
sentences.chinese: 香气扑鼻的食品使人食欲大增。

sentences.english: An off white to pale yellow free-flowing powder, with tangy citrus taste.
sentences.chinese: 米黄色自活动粉沫，带有幽香扑鼻的柑橘滋味。

sentences.english: This fragrant air freshener makes you sense a distinctive aroma all day long.
sentences.chinese: 这种芳香型空气清洁剂使您整天感到芳香扑鼻。

sentences.english: Rounds of bread aroma directly toward the muzzle, he energetically the Yanzhao saliva.
sentences.chinese: 一阵阵面包香味儿直扑鼻口，他使劲的咽着口水。

sentences.english: Some flowers is tangy scent, bright color, like colourful season.
sentences.chinese: 有的花是香味扑鼻，色泽鲜艳，就像艳季。

sentences.english: On the nose delicate aromas of vanilla, honey and pears with floral notes.
sentences.chinese: 香草，蜂蜜及梨子的芬芳伴着花香扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: Is in the classroom can also smell the fragrant come.
sentences.chinese: 就是在教室里也能闻到香气扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: The minute the door opened, a heady aroma of coffee drew me in.
sentences.chinese: 我一推开店门，浓郁醉人的咖啡香气便扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: Steamer one opened, red yeast rice aroma first aroma.
sentences.chinese: 蒸笼一掀开，红曲香味先扑鼻。

sentences.english: Nothing is packaged and there is a thick smell of raw meat and fish.
sentences.chinese: 都没有任何包装，而且鱼肉腥味扑鼻。

sentences.english: After Hanshuang not snow, a plum blossom-Pubi.
sentences.chinese: 不经一番寒霜雪，那得梅花扑鼻香。

sentences.english: Open the case and it strikes you immediately.
sentences.chinese: 当打开吉他盒子时，香味立刻扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: Without a cold biting, nothing is tangy incense.
sentences.chinese: 未经一番寒彻骨，焉得梅花扑鼻香。

definition: to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
(of a fragrance) to waft about/(fig.) (of foods) to become popular in other places as well
